name: A Musical Night and Book Launch of I'LL HAVE IT HERE with Jeet Thayil | 30 November, 5 PM
description: Jeet Thayil is back with a new poetry book after 16 long years, and we're so excited to be a part of the launch!  Join us as we celebrate the launch of I'LL HAVE IT HERE with Jeet Thayil and Rahul Soni. This discussion and reading will then be followed by an interactive Q&A with the audience, and a musical performance by Yashas and Hollis!  It's going to be an evening filled with poetry, music and conversations, and since there is limited seating we recommend you book your seat right away! Here is the  RSVP  link.  The details of the event are as follows:  DATE: 30 NOVEMBER 2024 DAY: SATURDAY TIME: 5 PM About the speakers: Jeet Thayil  worked as a journalist for twenty-one years, in Bombay, Bangalore, Hong Kong and New York City. In 2005 he began to write fiction. The first installment of his Bombay Trilogy, Narcopolis, was shortlisted for the Booker Prize and became an unlikely bestseller. His book of poems These Errors Are Correct won the Sahitya Akademi Award (India’s National Academy of Letters), and his musical collaborations include the opera Babur in London. His essays, poetry and short fiction have appeared in the New York Review of Books, Granta, TLS, Esquire, The London Magazine, The Guardian and The Paris Review, among other venues. Jeet Thayil is the editor of The Penguin Book of Indian Poets. Rahul Soni  is a writer and translator. He is currently Editor at Large with HarperCollins Publishers India.

name: Book Discussion: INTERSTELLAR MEGACHEF with Lavanya Lakshminarayan and Shrabonti Bagchi | 23 November, 5 PM
description: Join us at the bookstore to tune into this conversation between Lavanya Lakshminarayan and Shrabonti Bagchi as they discuss Lavanya's latest science-fiction novel,  INTERSTELLAR MEGACHEF.  The event details are as follows:  DATE: 23 NOVEMBER, SATURDAY TIME: 5 PM VENUE: CHAMPACA BOOKSTORE  Since there is limited seating, we recommend you to   RSVP  here to confirm your presence!  About the book Stepping off a long-haul star freighter from Earth, Saras Kaveri has one bag of clothes, her little flying robot Kili... and an invitation to compete in the galaxy's most watched, most prestigious cooking show.  Interstellar MegaChef  is the showcase of the planet Primus's austere, carefully synthesised cuisine. No one from Earth where they're so incredibly primitive they still cook with  fire   has ever graced its flowmetal cookstations before, or smiled awkwardly for its buzzing drone-cams. Until now. Corporate prodigy Serenity Ko, inventor of the smash-hit sim SoundSpace, has just got messily drunk at a floating bar, narrowly escaped an angry mob and been put on two weeks' mandatory leave to rest and get her work-life balance back. Perfect time to start a new project! And she's got just the idea: a sim for  food.  Now she just needs someone to teach her how to cook. A chance meeting in the back of a flying cab has Saras and Serenity Ko working together on a new technology that could change the future of food--and both their lives forever! About the speakers Lavanya Lakshminarayan  is the author of THE TEN PERCENT THIEF. She’s the first Indian woman to be shortlisted for the prestigious Arthur C. Clarke Award, and is currently a finalist for the Subjective Chaos Kind of Award. She's also a Locus Award finalist, and the winner of the Times of India AutHer Award and the Valley of Words Award. Her short fiction has appeared in a number of magazines and anthologies, including THE BIG BOOK OF CYBERPUNK and THE BEST OF WORLD SF: VOLUME 2. Lavanya is occasionally a game designer, and has built worlds for Zynga Inc.’s  FarmVille  and  Mafia Wars , among other games.  Shrabonti Bagchi  is a journalist and reviewer. She currently writes for Mint Lounge, a weekly magazine of art, culture, books and lifestyle.
